author: mklement0
body:
If you want a `$PSCmdlet.ShouldContinue()` to default to `N` (No), you must pass `$true` to the `hasSecurityImpact` parameter.

Unfortunately, doing so is currently tied to [this overload](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.management.automation.cmdlet.shouldcontinue?view=powershellsdk-1.1.0#System_Management_Automation_Cmdlet_ShouldContinue_System_String_System_String_System_Boolean_System_Boolean__System_Boolean__), which _invariably_ shows _additional_ prompts `Yes to All` and `No to All`.

`Yes to All` and `No to All` aren't always appropriate - sometimes you want a simple `Yes` / `No` confirmation prompt that defaults to `No`.

### Proposed Implementation

Add the following overload:

```csharp
public bool ShouldContinue (string query, string caption, bool hasSecurityImpact)
```

This would act like the existing `public bool ShouldContinue (string query, string caption)` overload, except that the default would be `N` (No) if `$true` is passed for `hasSecurityImpact`.
title: Add a $PSCmdlet.ShouldContinue() overload that defaults to No without needing to also show No to All and Yes to All prompts
